official_title: Coordinator of Field Education and Instructor of Social Work, MSW Program at Shanghai and New York
bio:
Qian Xie is Coordinator of Field Education and a Clinical Instructor of Social Work at the NYU Shanghai Campus. Bilingual in Chinese and English, Xie is an experienced practitioner with expertise in social services for children, parents, the elderly, and people with disabilities. She has previously taught in the BSW and MSW programs at Shanghai Normal University and conducted trainings in social work theory and practice for community-based agencies and committees. As vice secretary of the Shanghai Puddong Social Work Association, Xie created, implemented, and supervised clinical programs. In addition, Xie promoted professional development projects such as training social worker supervisors and founding the Le'ai Social Worker Office, which serves people with disabilities. 
 

Education:

  • MSW, Hong Kong Univeristy (2006)
  • MA, Sichuan International Studies University (2001)
  • BA, Sichuan International Studies University (1995)

 

Languages:

English, Mandarin
